Detailed Description

SerialTerminal is a terminal to the Sio. It can connect and disconnect to the serial IO, and read and write data from and to it.

SerialTerminal::Result SerialTerminal::Read (  void *  buffer,
UINT16  buffer_size,
UINT16 &  bytes_read
) 
 

Reads the data available from SIO and writes it into the buffer. if bytes_read is equal to buffer_size, more data may be available. if bytes_read is 0, then no more data is available at the moment, the client will be informed, when data is available by sending a message.

Parameters:
buffer pointer to the read buffer
buffer_size size of the read buffer
bytes_read specifies size of data actually read from the SIO.
Returns:
Terminal::Result::c_ok on success

static void SerialTerminal::ReleaseSerialTerminal (  SerialTerminal *  terminal  )  [inline, static]
 

Release a Terminal, if it is not in use anymore. Be aware, that any use will raise an assertion afterwards. Do not delete the object, but release any reference to it.

Result SerialTerminal::SetAtMode (  BOOLEAN  enable  ) 
 

Enable AT Mode

Parameters:
enable desired state of AT mode
Returns:
Terminal::Result::c_ok on success

void SerialTerminal::SetListener (  SerialTerminalListener *  listener  ) 
 

Set listener wich is called on terminal events

SerialTerminal::Result SerialTerminal::Write (  const void *  buffer,
UINT16  buffer_size,
UINT16 &  bytes_written
) 
 

Writes buffer_size bytes from the buffer to the SIO.

Parameters:
buffer the buffer to write to the SIO.
buffer_size size of the buffer handed over
bytes_written specifies the size of the data written to the SIO.
Returns:
Terminal::Result::c_ok on success
